segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, management, and security considerations for the Interactive logon Machine inactivity limit security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, management, and security considerations for the Interactive logon Machine inactivity limit security policy setting.

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, management, and security considerations for the Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, management, and security considerations for the Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit security policy setting.

segment.source: Beginning with Windows Server 2012 and Windows 8, Windows detects user-input inactivity of a sign-in (logon) session by using the security policy setting Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit.
segment.target: Beginning with Windows Server 2012 and Windows 8, Windows detects user-input inactivity of a sign-in (logon) session by using the security policy setting Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit.

segment.source: If the amount of inactive time exceeds the inactivity limit set by this policy, then the user’s session locks by invoking the screen saver.
segment.target: If the amount of inactive time exceeds the inactivity limit set by this policy, then the user’s session locks by invoking the screen saver.

segment.source: This policy setting allows you to control the locking time by using Group Policy.
segment.target: This policy setting allows you to control the locking time by using Group Policy.

segment.source: The automatic lock of the device is set in elapsed seconds of inactivity, which can range from zero (0) to 599,940 seconds (166.65 hours).
segment.target: The automatic lock of the device is set in elapsed seconds of inactivity, which can range from zero (0) to 599,940 seconds (166.65 hours).

segment.source: If no value (blank) or zero (0) is present in the Machine will be locked after input field, then the policy setting is disabled and no action is taken on user-input inactivity for the session.
segment.target: If no value (blank) or zero (0) is present in the Machine will be locked after input field, then the policy setting is disabled and no action is taken on user-input inactivity for the session.

segment.source: Set the time for elapsed user-input inactivity based on the device’s usage and location requirements.
segment.target: Set the time for elapsed user-input inactivity based on the device’s usage and location requirements.

segment.source: For example, if the device or device is in a public area, you might want to have the device automatically lock after a short period of inactivity to prevent unauthorized access.
segment.target: For example, if the device or device is in a public area, you might want to have the device automatically lock after a short period of inactivity to prevent unauthorized access.

segment.source: However, if the device is used by an individual or group of trusted individuals, such as in a restricted manufacturing area, automatically locking the device might hinder productivity.
segment.target: However, if the device is used by an individual or group of trusted individuals, such as in a restricted manufacturing area, automatically locking the device might hinder productivity.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Restart is required for changes to this policy to become effective when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Restart is required for changes to this policy to become effective when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: Because this policy setting was introduced in Windows Server 2012 and Windows 8, it can only be set locally on those computers that contain this policy setting, but it can be set and distributed through Group Policy to any computer running the Windows operating system that supports Group Policy.
segment.target: Because this policy setting was introduced in Windows Server 2012 and Windows 8, it can only be set locally on those computers that contain this policy setting, but it can be set and distributed through Group Policy to any computer running the Windows operating system that supports Group Policy.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: This policy setting helps you prevent unauthorized access to devices under your control when the currently signed-in user leaves without deliberately locking the desktop.
segment.target: This policy setting helps you prevent unauthorized access to devices under your control when the currently signed-in user leaves without deliberately locking the desktop.

segment.source: In versions earlier than Windows Server 2012 and Windows 8, the desktop-locking mechanism was set on individual computers in Personalization in Control Panel.
segment.target: In versions earlier than Windows Server 2012 and Windows 8, the desktop-locking mechanism was set on individual computers in Personalization in Control Panel.

segment.source: Set the time for elapsed user-input inactivity time by using the security policy setting Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit based on the device’s usage and location requirements.
segment.target: Set the time for elapsed user-input inactivity time by using the security policy setting Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit based on the device’s usage and location requirements.

segment.source: This security policy setting can limit unauthorized access to unsecured computers; however, that requirement must be balanced with the productivity requirements of the intended user.
segment.target: This security policy setting can limit unauthorized access to unsecured computers; however, that requirement must be balanced with the productivity requirements of the intended user.
